text.section:
The Commission may commence a civil action in the appropriate circuit court if the Commission has probable cause to believe that:
a person or group of persons is engaged in a pattern or practice of resistance to the full enjoyment of any of the rights granted by this part and Subtitle 7 of this title; or
any group of persons has been denied any of the rights granted by this part and Subtitle 7 of this title; and
the resistance or denial raises an issue of general public importance.

The Commission or other party at whose request a subpoena is issued under this part may enforce a subpoena in appropriate proceedings in the circuit court for the county in which the person to whom the subpoena was addressed resides, was served, or transacts business.

section.section:
In a civil action under subsection (a) of this section, the court may:
award preventive relief, including a permanent or temporary injunction, restraining order, or other order against the person responsible for a violation of Subtitle 7 of this title as necessary to assure the full enjoyment of the rights granted by Subtitle 7 of this title;
award other relief the court considers appropriate, including monetary damages to aggrieved persons; and
to vindicate the public interest, assess a civil penalty against the respondent:
In a civil action under this section, the court may allow the prevailing party, including the Commission, reasonable attorney's fees and costs.

On timely application, a person may intervene in a civil action commenced by the Commission under subsection (a) or (b) of this section, if the action involves:
an alleged discriminatory housing practice to which the person is an aggrieved person; or
a conciliation agreement to which the person is a party.
The court may grant any appropriate relief to any intervening party that is authorized to be granted to a plaintiff in a civil action under § 20-1035 of this subtitle.
